In one such chat, Miyazaki strays perilously close to airing the "themes or core elements" of whatever game or games FromSoftware are working on post-Elden Ring, commenting that he has been inspired, albeit perhaps in a "short-term way", by the experience of having a daughter.
 
Read more
articles.title: Elden Ring boss Hidetaka Miyazaki reflects on how becoming a father might influence his future games

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I'd been in Paris to see open world action-RPG Shadow Of The Erdtree early and when I got back, Edwin messaged me. He asked whether I thought it was big enough to consider the DLC a pseudo-sequel, and at the time I said something along the lines of, "It's hefty, but I think that's probably pushing it".
I was wrong. The Land Of Shadow may not be as expansive as the base game's Lands Between, but it's knottier, denser, more of a twisting mass that burrows into the earth and soars into the skies. For this reason I think it produces some of Elden Ring's finest moments, as exploration leads to a truer sense of discovery reminiscent of old Souls. But I also think its sheer density exposes more chinks in its open world format, where its interconnected sprawl leads to even greater recollection paralysis.
Read more
articles.title: Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree review: yeah, it's basically a sequel

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Steam Next Fest 2024 has formally ended, we've spent a couple of weeks gorging upon demos of all stripes, from oil spill clean-up to dancefloor kendo, and now comes the all-important process of deciding which of those demos Won. Valve have helpfully shared a list of the most played Steam demos during this latest, gravest round of next festivity, and it covers a reasonable range. I mean, I wasn't that surprised to see an open world survival shooter with monsters at the top of the ladder - why else would we dedicate a bunch of Best Of features to such things? - but I am surprised that number three is a leering parody of neglect. Also, there's a game about mopping dungeons that appeals strongly to my Dungeon Meshi-watching sensibilities.
 
Read more
articles.title: Steam Next Fext 2024's most popular demos include goblin maid sims, horror shooters and a Chinese game about an unmarried no-lifer

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The Remake Of The End Of The Greatest RPG Of All Time, or TROTEOTGRPGOAT for, uh, short, is a game that exists. I normally wouldn’t let such an opaque stub of a description survive outside of a quick Trello reminder to write something better later, but I’m currently finding it fulfilling enough just to gaze upon that title and consider the fully formed art object that may soon emerge from its tantalising promises. Ok, so the visual component helps too. Orientate yourself by means of the trailer below, and let’s dig into this brazen nose-hooker of a head turner of a game that does exist, about another game that doesn’t.
Read more
articles.title: The Remake Of The End Of The Greatest RPG Of All Time is a puzzle game hidden inside a fictional RPG

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
You forgot about Habbo Hotel, didn't you? Habbo Hotel. With those words and the above image, it is possible I have sent a shocking dose of neurochemical nostalgia through your brain and into your various internal organs. Your vision blurs. You sweat. You are 12 years old again, frightened and intrigued at the idea of graduating to teenhood, bathing in the cool glow of a cream-coloured CRT computer monitor. "Habbo Hotel is back!" is what I might shout if I did not know better, snapping you back to the present day in an act of psychological whiplash. The truth is the pixellated hangout zone of the early 2000s never went away. It has been alive this whole time. You forgot about the Hotel. But the Hotel did not forget about you.
Today, developers Sulake are doing something to jog your memory. They are calling it Habbo Hotel: Origins. I ask you to think carefully before you go there.
Read more
articles.title: The Habbos return in Habbo Hotel: Origins, a relaunch of the 2000s chatroom game

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Edwin backstory fragment #345: the greatest usage to which I have ever put my failing grasp of mathematics is determining how many different RPGs I could buy using the "same" money, by dint of trading them in promptly at Gamestation for carefully calculated diminishing returns. I'd save up to buy one of the premium headliners, attempt to get my money's worth inside a week, then swap it for a respected double-A and perhaps a sub-£8 oddity with the manual missing - nesting one purchase within the other like a series of Matryoshka dolls.
This was my Big Short, my Moneyball. But it had a drawback: often, I was so eager to leapfrog to another game before the trade-in price changed that I skimmed RPGs that are now considered classics. The big one was Suikoden 2, which I spent only an evening with before gambling that I'd eke more FunValue out of a game with a less traditional battle system. I can't remember what I traded that for, which says it all. Another was Baten Kaitos on Gamecube, which - yes, we are finally getting to the point here - has just been rereleased on Steam in the shape of a Baten Kaitos I & II HD Remaster. I can't remember what I traded Baten Kaitos for either, which again, says it all. Please, gentle reader - be better.
 
Read more
articles.title: Bandai Namco's rather glorious-looking Baten Kaitos RPG remasters are now on Steam

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Life By You, the Sims-like management game previously troubled by several delays, has been canceled by Paradox Interactive, and Californian studio Paradox Tectonic have been shut down. The news of the game’s cancellation came last night through a forum post, with Paradox deputy CEO Mattias Lilja painting a picture of a game still too “lacking” for more development time to fix. This morning, it emerged that Paradox Tectonic, the studio working on the game, have been shuttered, via GameWatcher.
 
Read more
articles.title: Paradox shutter studio Tectonic and cancel troubled Sims competitor Life By You

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Starfield’s first expansion, this year’s Shattered Space, won’t be the only major DLC for the sci-fi exploration game, Bethesda bossman Todd Howard has confirmed.
Read more
articles.title: Starfield will get at least one more expansion after Shattered Space, Todd Howard says

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
A Quiet Place is a very solid horror movie that seemed primed for a video game adaptation from the off. After all, it already had all the ingredients of a video game right there: the whole film is essentially one overlong stealth mission with a punishing fail state - any crunchy glass or other noise would immediately draw the attention of deadly alien monsters - and at one point there’s a whiteboard with the narrative equivalent of Dead Space’s “CUT OFF THEIR LIMBS” graffiti scrawled on it. Lo and behold, we’re getting a Quiet Place video game.
Read more
articles.title: A Quiet Place video game resurfaces with a new name, first look at gameplay and 2024 release date

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Baldur's Gate 3’s upcoming mod support update, which will introduce official modding tools to the sprawling Dungeons & Dragons RPG later this year, will effectively serve as Larian’s swan song for their work on the game.
Read more
articles.title: Baldur’s Gate 3 mod update will be Larian’s ‘final handover’ to players

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Remember Lords of the Fallen? No, not that one. This one. Last year’s reboot of the 2014 game of exactly the same name - despite the successor originally being a numbered sequel, then at least having a ‘The’ at the start of its title to help tell them apart a little - will now get its own follow-up in a third Lords of the Fallen game. The upcoming sequel doesn’t have a name yet, but I really hope they stick with the bit and just call it “Lords of the Fallen” again.
Read more
articles.title: Lords of the Fallen reboot Lords of the Fallen is getting a sequel in 2026, probably called Lords of the Fallen

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Fumes has starred in a few Screenshot Saturday round-ups but this is the first time, to my knowledge, that somebody from the Treehouse has slipped behind the wheel and taken this crusty old banger for a spin. I am glad to have done so. Created by a team of four, Fumes is the Mad Max X Vigilante 8 adaptation somebody really should have made in the 90s, when the very thought of such a thing would have had me flipping tables and then sheepishly righting them again, before being sent to bed with no dinner.
It's an open world combat racer with boisterous arcade handling, pop-out guns that wiggle about like hood ornaments, some kaiju-wannabe boss vehicles, a delightfully crunchy, sooty artstyle and a passably earwormy metal soundtrack. I'm not entirely convinced it has longevity beyond its impeccably scorched and dented PS1 vibes, but I definitely think you should try the demo, now that the early access version is out.
 Read more
articles.title: Fumes is a Mad Max-tinted open world Twisted Metal full of absolutely furious rally cars

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The perpetually scarlet-faced and jovially maladroit folk of Embracer have done their usual vaudeville comedy routine of spinning around with negative-dollar signs in their eyes and trampling on another game development studio - in this case, Pieces Interactive, creators of the recent Alone In The Dark reboot. The Swedish studio's website is now a tombstone, bearing the dates 2007-2024. Oopsy-daisy!

 
Read more
articles.title: Embracer shut down Alone In The Dark rebooters Pieces Interactive, creators of Magicka and Titan Quest DLCs

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Scottish petrochemical horror is not exactly a genre, but maybe it ought to be. From the opening moments of Still Wakes The Deep you know life on its 1970s North Sea oil rig is precarious. Leaky ceilings, busted panelling, faulty drill machinery - the omens pile up as you spend your first thirty minutes wandering through the colleague-packed canteen and over the platform into the boss' office for a severe dressing-down. It's a classic pre-disaster setup for a mostly traditional monster story, yet the game sticks expertly to the first-person horror form, and its voice actors' performances are so spot-on, that it'd feel churlish to judge this foaming fear simulator for sticking to type. It also has some markedly unsettling use of the shipping forecast, a famously dull feature of British radio I definitely did not expect to freak me out in a video game.
Read more
articles.title: Still Wakes The Deep review: soaked in sea horror and shiveringly good voice acting

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Well, shovel me timbers! Shovel Knight, the retro platformer that started it all (it all being everything from a roguelike spin-off to a Dead Cells cameo) turns 10 this month, and Yacht Club Games are releasing a ultimate edition to celebrate. Entitled the ‘Shovel Of Hope DX’, this definitive-me-doo bundles in the original game with old and new features like saving and rewinding, over 20 playable characters, local and online co-op, and new modes. Grab your shovel and prepare to dig for the trailer, then look foolish as you realise it’s directly below this paragraph.
 
Read more
articles.title: Shovel Knight is getting online co-op as part of a new Shovel Of Hope DX edition for its 10th anniversary

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
"Two's company, three's a crowd," the saying goes, unless the first two are warriors and the third one is a priest, in which case the superior proverb is surely "three's a moderately balanced squad, two's a massive liability"? Here to put such kitchen wisdom to the test is BioWare's Dragon Age: The Veilguard, which "only" allows you to bring two companions into the fray, one fewer than 2014's Dragon Age: Inquisition. It's another indication that this will be more biffy action game than thinky party-based RPG. The upside, assuming you find that last sentence disappointing, is that exploration and combat will be more "intimate", and individual characters will have more screentime to bounce off each other and flourish as personalities. All this comes care of a BioWare Discord Q&A from late last week, which you can watch in full below.
 Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard strips your RPG party down to two companions, but they'll be "deeper" with a lot more banter

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
This once verdant ground is now wrecked by the passage of time. My terrible nemesis looms before me, inevitable and devastating. Many have fallen to it, but I will overcome. Oh, Elden Ring? I was talking about male pattern baldness. It will eventually destroy all that was once beautiful about my hairline, but at least I’ll have five fancy new hairdos to pick from when the open world RPG’s newest free update releases this Thursday, 20th of June. There’s also some QOL tweaks to inventory management and summoning pools, but I can’t wear those, can I?
 
Read more
articles.title: While you're waiting for Shadow Of The Erdtree, Elden Ring has some free hair for you

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Beloved friends, hated enemies - last week, we let the side down. Due to a shortage of hands at the pump and persistent clouds of Geoff Keighley activity, there was no weekly Maw liveblog, and this has bred disaster. Shaken, stirred and finally ignited for want of two-sentence updates about Dragon Age, the Maw emitted a full 13% of its cosmo-puissance into Mundus and took a grievous bite out of the ailing and fearful lasagne of reality itself. Hated friends, beloved enemies - I am very sad to say that the proud nation of Dimplexland is no more.
 Read more
articles.title: The Maw - 17th-22nd June 2024

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! Books obviously come in many different sizes, but did you know that there’s an obscure law that dictates the legal limit for how long a novel can be? It’s measured in ‘George Martins’. If your story is more than three ‘Georges’ wide, you’re swiftly escorted to a cell and made to eat any bits of book that reference more than three characters in a scene with the same surname. This week, it's developer and writer of the legendarily good Radiator Blog, Robert Yang! Cheers Robert! Mind if we have a nose at your bookshelf?
 
Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: art game maker and level design expert Robert Yang

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for hoping the plumber has ordered that new sink part in. My sink is ‘non-standard’ apparently. "Why can't I just be normal?!" I scream in silent longing. Armitage Shanks would never. Before I look forward to no longer having to wash up my pasta bowl in the same place I brush my teeth, let’s read this week’s best writing about games (and game related things!)
 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Lollipop Chainsaw RePop, a refresh of the 2012 hack-and-slasher about a cheerleader fighting hordes of zombies, finally has a release date: September 25th. It also has a first trailer, showing it in action with the new, less violent "RePop mode".

 
Read more
articles.title: Lollipop Chainsaw RePop will arrive on PC this September with 4K and 60fps support

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
League Of Geeks are going "into hibernation". The Australian developers behind fantasy strategy games such as the animal-themed Armello and hellish remake Solium Infernum said that their remaining staff are going to take an extended break, and they're not sure "when (or if)" they will revive the studio.

 
Read more
articles.title: Armello and Solium Infernum developers League Of Geeks are going "into hibernation"

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The developers of Wizard With A Gun are closing down. Galvanic Games, who released the sandbox survival game last year, said that ongoing sales of the game were not enough to keep the studio going, and they'd run out of time to find funding for a new project.

 
Read more
articles.title: Wizard With A Gun developer Galvanic Games are closing down

articles.author: Ollie Toms
articles.description:
You may notice there's a stowaway this week. He crept in during all the recent kerfuffle, and secreted himself in a cosy little nook of the treehouse. He was quickly discovered, but despite patient attempts to explain that it's  been several years since he was last here, and as per tradition he's now dead to us, we've so far been unable to dislodge him. Like the smiley face hidden in the above image, he's just... there. So I decided, hell, let's hear what he's playing this weekend as well.
Here's what we're all clicking on this weekend!
 Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Former Dragon Age lead writer and Summerfall Games co-founder David Gaider has strung together some opinions on Xitter - the original spawning ground for all opinions - about the full reveal video for Dragon Age: The Veilguard, expressing broad enthusiasm for the new RPG’s narrative tone, combat system and environments, while offering a more ambivalent analysis of BioWare's decision to let players seduce every last member of their party.
Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age's former lead writer has many, mostly positive thoughts on Veilguard's romance options, story and environments

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
There’ve been a ton of Jackbox Party Packs over the last near-decade, each following a fairly similar structure: one or two standout games you’ll want to replay, a couple you might dip into every now and then, and at least one you’ll try once and then never bother with again. With 10 different packs to pick from, it becomes an increasing fuss to remember which pack has which game in, and then boot it up just to play its highlight before repeating the process when you choose to play something else.
Read more
articles.title: Jackbox Party Pack is finally adding a shared launcher to switch between the best of each game collection

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Cities: Skylines 2 has found a delightfully straightforward solution to the very real-world problem of greedy landlords demanding excessive rent payments. The city-builder sequel will simply delete all its virtual leeches in its next patch, helping to bring down the cost of living in your digital metropolis.
Read more
articles.title: Cities: Skylines 2 achieves ultimate catharsis by deleting landlords to fix spiralling rent prices in its next patch

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
A remaster of Final Fantasy Tactics, the grid-based strategy spin-off from the RPG series that easily ranks as one of the best Final Fantasy games ever made, is reportedly in the works - giving hope of its first official PC release.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy Tactics remaster reportedly “real and happening”, giving hope for one of the series’ finest to finally come to PC

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Look, everyone wants to play Bloodborne on PC. It’s one of those universally accepted truths, like gravity or pizza being delicious. And, yes, nobody really knows why Bloodborne isn’t on PC yet, almost a decade after it released on PlayStation 4 - despite Sony’s apparent delight in bringing every other PlayStation exclusive to PC, just to mock us. It’s one of those universally accepted unknowns, like how gravity works or the actual best pizza topping. (It’s glue, if you believe AI.)
Read more
articles.title: Souls devs FromSoftware also want Bloodborne on PC, even if the game's own director can’t admit it

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Every so often in the ignoble craft of james gournalism you stumble on a game that reminds you why you got into this weird and silly trade, a game that slices through the phantasmagorical mulch of a million Summer Game Fest announcements and clears the portals of the brain. It seems mad to think of Kanitsu-Gami: Path Of The Goddess this way, given that on some level, it is a tower defence game. Tower defence! The archetypal browser-based strategy experience and darling of emerging smartphones. The great-uncle once-removed of today's idle clickers. Without meaning any disrespect to those currently working in the genre, which I've had a tonne of fun with, when's the last time you were seriously excited by tower defence? As of this week, I am seriously excited by tower defence, because Path Of The Goddess has captured my imagination. It's a stately, beautiful thing. I had a go at this year's Keighleycon, and it's one of two games at the show I wanted to carry on playing once my time was up. Thank goodness it's out (on Steam and the Xbox store) in just a month or so's time.

 
Read more
articles.title: Kunitsu-Gami: Path Of The Goddess was the best game I played at Summer Game Fest

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Back in February, Graham wrote about potential redundancies at Disco Elysium studio ZA/UM following the cancellation of a standalone expansion to that game, codenamed X7. Now, PC Gamer’s Ted Litchfield has spoken to 12 current and former employees about the circumstances surrounding the cancellation, notably the details of the layoffs, the expansion, and the “humiliation campaign” suffered by writer Argo Tuulik  as apparent retaliation for his participation in last year’s extensive People Make Games documentary. You can, and should, read PC Gamer’s report here.
 
Read more
articles.title: Disco Elysium studio bosses humiliated the cancelled expansion's lead writer for speaking to journalists, claims report

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The impenetrable wall of crossover fiction known as Kingdom Hearts has come to Steam. The games have been on Epic Games Store since 2021, so they're not new to PC folk. But this does open them up to players who shy away from Epic's storefront. I use the term "open up" loosely, because Kingdom Hearts is popularly regarded as a tangle of criss-crossing JRPG confuse-o-plots that require diagrams and multiple explainer videos to follow. I don't know if that's true, having never followed Alice down this Buster Sword-shaped rabbit hole, but it is the popular joke. And, looking into Goofy's cold, dead eyes, I find I am afraid to question it.
Read more
articles.title: The Kingdom Hearts games are now out on Steam, don't ask me to explain them

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
UK national treasures Inkle - they who looped the globe in 80 days, vaulted the heavens and sang of the highlands - are making a brand new investigation-ma-jig called Miss Mulligatawney's School For Promising Girls, though the presskit notes that this might not be the final title. It's set in a 1920s boarding school, where you can expect "tuition in Latin, Geometry and a wide range of team sports, all within the beautiful setting of our isolated country estate". Also some murders, possibly.

 
Read more
articles.title: The developers of 80 Days and Heaven's Vault are making a 1920s school detective mystery

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The orcs and goblins of the Greenskins, the sizeable gourmands of the Ogre Kingdoms, and the angry Christmas ornaments of Khorne are the next three factions to get new units, lords, and campaigns as part of strategy game Total War: Warhammer 3’s next DLC. The news comes via official  posts by developer Creative Assembly on both Reddit and X.
 
Read more
articles.title: Greenskins, Ogres, and Khorne are all coming in the next DLC for Total War: Warhammer 3

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Everywhere is a creative suite that aims to let players build their own 3D games - such as shooters, racing games, and platformers - without code. Instead, players can use a developer- and user-created asset library to build and "remix" game worlds, then publish them for other folks to play. 

Those creative tools will be available to some people next week, when the closed Builders Beta launches on June 18th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Everywhere's no-code game creation tools get a closed beta next week

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
When I play Minecraft, I mostly just want to build things, or maybe go exploring across its landscapes, which still have the power to surprise and delight me. My son, meanwhile, mostly wants to murder me - and in the game.

The Tricky Trials update, out now, might help redirect his bloodlust. It adds trial chambers full of traps and treasure, including waves of hostile mobs to battle against.

 
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft's Tricky Trials update is out, adding new challenge chambers, mobs and an auto-crafter

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Prince Of Persia: The Lost Crown's first story DLC got a two-second trailer during Ubisoft Forward on Monday, confirming its name and its coming release this September. Here's a more specific release date that'll matter more to some of you: The Lost Crown itself will come to Steam on August 8th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Prince Of Persia: The Lost Crown is coming to Steam in August

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The latest Helldivers 2 patch is memorably titled 01.000.400, but for my money, it's hovering on the  brink of being one of your gold-varnished "X.0" updates of note. It adds a fair few mechanics and makes various substantial adjustments to Arrowhead and Sony's liberty-humping, cheerily xenocidal squad shooter. 
Read more
articles.title: Comically vast Helldivers 2 patch adds to the game's Galactic strategy map while making stealth easier and armoured enemies fewer

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In the past I've described Phantom Blade Zero, the foetid and frantic new action-RPG from Chinese studio S-Game, as a Soulslike, and more specifically a Sekirolike. I must now hang my head and await the executioner's ludicrously oversized hammer, for while Phantom Blade Zero's ambience and layouts owe something to From's work, the moment-to-moment has just as much in common with older hack-and-slash games such as Ninja Gaiden. I played a bit of it at Summer Game Fest this week, and while I’m not rushing out to preorder (I never am, in fairness), I think it could be a good ‘un.
 
Read more
articles.title: In the hands, Phantom Blade Zero owes more to Ninja Gaiden than Soulslikes

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Ten years ago, we were drowning in early access survival games about chopping trees and crafting camp fires. Rust pit monstrous players against one another, DayZ had us dashing around for beans and bleach, while The Forest creeped us the hell out in a dark jungle. There was even a week-long celebration here at RPS called survival week to get the genre out of our systems. A lot of those games have since graduated to a full 1.0 release, but one survivalist shambled on. 7 Days To Die is a solid sandbox craft 'em up with zombie hordes, and it never left the comfort of its early access log cabin surrounded by spikes and land mines. But a (tentative) release date is finally on the horizon, according to the developers. And it's quite soon.
Read more
articles.title: After 10 years in early access, 7 Days To Die finally has a release date for version 1.0

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This piece is written in memory of the Alpha Doshaguma, a huge furry quadruped with the belly, gait and mournful disposition of an orphaned St Bernard, which - no, who was sleeping blamelessly in a canyon when Capcom's demo presenter strolled up and bopped it with a bayonet howitzer. The demo in question was for Monster Hunter Wilds, which they probably should rename Monster Hadron Collider in that a major selling point appears to be making the megafauna converge and murder each other. It's possible to do this in previous games, especially 2018's Monster Hunter: World, but not like this. Not like this. Alas for the Alpha Doshaguma. Getting rocket-speared in the bum was only the start of its worst day ever.

 
Read more
articles.title: RIP Alpha Doshaguma, the doomed dragonfighting guinea pig of my Monster Hunter Wilds demo

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Phantom Line, the PVE co-op shooter formerly known as Hornet, has an early demo available until the 18th of June, 2024. It’s from Antistatic Studios, who include former Cyberpunk 2077, Bioshock, and Borderlands devs among their ranks. The FPS lets you and up to three great mates fill the ectoplasm-stained tactical boots worn by members of the ‘paranormal SWAT’, where you’ll explore large maps and try to contain strange goings on. You’ll need to join the game’s Discord if you want to play. Trailer below.
 
Read more
articles.title: Phantom Line, the "paranormal SWAT" shooter from former Cyberpunk and Bioshock devs, has a time-limited demo

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Mental Salvo describes itself as having an "infinite open world" in which you can do so many things, "they're impossible to list". Were this a game from a triple-A publisher, I'd be heading down to their compound with some powerful magnets and cannisters of highly concentrated acid to wipe out their ungodly creation before it replaces the fundamental particles of our universe with waypoints. But Mental Salvo is actually the work of new indie imaginini (yes, no capital-I), and is a "top down art adventure with light RPG elements" that is perhaps a bit ZANY but also, refreshingly playful in essentially being about poking a big white screen to see what tumbles out of it.
 
Read more
articles.title: Mental Salvo is an "infinite open world" art game full of procedurally generated surprises

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Excuse me, sorry, pardon me, can I just, thank you, ah, sorry, thanks... Phew, made it. Steam Next Fest is pretty crowded, eh? As if the unholy swarm of trailers and game announcements from Summer Game Fest was not enough, this week the fearful megalords at Valve decided to drop their regular cavalcade of coming-soons onto their megastore. The beautiful (and terrifying) thing about Next Fest, of course, is the overwhelming number of demos that come out during the event. A small herd of video games are standing on my toes as we speak. But that's okay, we are expert curators. Here's a handy list of our nine favourite demos of the lot.
Read more
articles.title: Our 9 favourite demos from the summer Steam Next Fest

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
In what is possibly the biggest scandal the UK has seen since the last time the price of Freddos went up, a digital rights campaigner is suing Valve for £656m in compensation, accusing the company of overcharging and anti-competitive behaviour. The accompanying website describes the collective action claim as a “ground-breaking legal action,” which is very gamer of them. 16 times the litigation, etc.
 
Read more
articles.title: Valve owe you 44 quid, according to a £656m lawsuit against the company for allegedly overcharging UK customers

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
It’s been a decade - 10 years! - since Dragon Age: Inquisition. It’s fair to assume that you might’ve forgotten what happened during the last Dragon Age game, or some of the specific choices you made back in the misty ages of 2014. Whether you remember or not, this year’s long-awaited sequel Dragon Age: The Veilguard should have you covered, with the ability to carry over your story choices from the previous game and get a refresher on what happened last time around.
Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard will let you bring over your choices from Inquisition - whether you still have your save or not

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Shadow Of The Erdtree is out in under 10 days, but some players must be in for a surprise if they expect to be able to jump in straight away. As it turns out, most players on Steam haven’t even progressed far enough in the original game to access the DLC - something publishers Bandai Namco have now issued a friendly FYI about.
Read more
articles.title: Most Elden Ring players on Steam won’t even be able to play its Shadow of the Erdtree DLC next week

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: S technologií pattern matchingu resp. vylepšenou formou strukturální pattern matching jsme se zde již setkali. V jazyku Coconut je strukturální pattern matching všudypřítomným prvkem a je „mocnější“, než v Pythonu.
articles.title: Pattern matching v programovacím jazyku Coconut

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CSIRT.CZ)
articles.description: Proběhlo největší evropské cvičení v oblasti kyberbezpečnosti, VMware záplatoval dvě kritické chyby, Kaspersky Labs má v USA zákaz, Quishing je na vzestupu a kolem burzy Kraken vyrůstá zajímavá kauza – to jsou jen některé ze zajímavostí uplynulého týdne v oblasti bezpečnosti.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: Proběhlo Cyber Europe 2024, Kaspersky v USA končí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Google přesune vývoj Chrome OS od linuxového základu k Androidu. Canonical s DeepComputing chystají notebook s RISC-V a Ubuntu. Vyšel postmarketOS 24.06, prostředí Cinnamon 6.2 se stihne dostat do Linux Mintu 22.
articles.title: Chromium OS přechází na Android, RISC-V notebook s Ubuntu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ovladač GPU Raspberry Pi 5 snad brzy v upstreamu, Mike Blumenkrantz z Valve zase válí, zrychlil Mesa/glReadPixels, ovladač Intel Xe zase blíže i915, dostává podporu Platform Monitoring Technology.
articles.title: Režim černobílé TV v Linuxu 6.11, darktable 4.8 opět bez AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ještě další tři roky mohou provozovatelé strojů s CentOS 7 čerpat placenou podporu. Ne však u Red Hatu, ale u SUSE, a to v rámci programu SUSE Liberty Linux. Podpora CentOS 7 tak nakonec dosáhne délky téměř 14 let.
articles.title: Red Hat končí s CentOS 7, jeho další podporu nabízí SUSE, první rok za 50 Kč měsíčně

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na článek o „univerzálním“ transpileru py2many dnes navážeme a dokončíme popis možností a schopností tohoto nástroje. Ukážeme si způsob překladu konstrukcí async a await, try a except, použití pattern matchingu i překlad kódů s definicí tříd.
articles.title: Projekt py2many: dokončení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si otestujeme sítě, vyzkoušíme aplikaci pro automatické klikání, dáme si dohromady svoje úkoly pomocí Kanbanu a podíváme se na prohlížeč 3D modelů.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (19. 6. 2024): automatické klikání myší pro Wayland i X11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V dnešním článku se seznámíme se základními vlastnostmi projektu py2many, který dokáže překládat zdrojové kódy z Pythonu do dalších jazyků, včetně C++, Rustu, Go či jazyku Julia.
articles.title: Projekt py2many: transpiler Pythonu do dalších programovacích jazyků

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Kopřiva)
articles.description: V dnešním díle Postřehů se podíváme na novinky okolo návrhu zákona o kybernetické bezpečnosti, změny v plánovaném nasazení funkce Recall do Windows nebo kompromitaci desítek tisíc zařízení FortiGate ze strany čínských státních aktérů…
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: novela zákona o kybernetické bezpečnosti doporučena ke schválení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Unixový operační systém Redox OS využívá komponenty prostředí COSMIC. Centrum aplikací Ubuntu přidává podporu instalátoru balíčků DEB. Distribuce AlmaLinux OS oficiálně podporuje jednodeskový počítač Raspberry Pi 5.
articles.title: COSMIC na Redox OS, Ubuntu s instalátorem DEB

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Qualcomm v dubnu představil nové ARM SoC Snapdragon X Elite (12 jader) a Snapdragon X Plus (10 jader). Jsou primárně určené pro notebooky s Windows (ARM edice), ale pravděpodobně budou fungovat také s Linuxem.
articles.title: Podpora GPU Snapdragon X Elite bude v jádře 6.11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Před dvěma týdny vývojář v důchodu Martin C. Martin objevil chybu v 55 let staré hře Lunar Lander. Tu vytvořil tenkrát 17letý student střední školy Jim Storer v roce 1969, jen několik měsíců po prvním přistání lidí na Měsíci.
articles.title: Objevena chyba v 55 let staré hře Lunar Lander

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Zajímá vás moderní přístup ke službám a témata jako Docker, kontejnery, cloud, virtualizace a Kubernetes? Připravili jsme pro vás čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes, na který můžete získat dotaci až 82 % od Úřadu práce. Kontaktujte naši kolegyni pavla.hettnerova@iinfo.cz.
articles.title: Čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes dotovaný Úřadem práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Eclypsium objevilo novou kritickou zranitelnost CVE-2024–0762, které dalo přezdívku UEFIcanhazbufferowerflow. Jde o zranitelnost UEFI Phoenix v modulu pro TPM. Pro zranitelnost ale ani nemusí být TPM přítomen. Chyba byla objevena v Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon 7th Gen a X1 Yoga 4th Gen. Nicméně Phoenix později oznámil, že se chyba týká patrně všech jejich UEFI firmware s procesory Intel AlderLake, CoffeeLake, CometLake, IceLake, JasperLake, KabyLake, MeteorLake, RaptorLake, RocketLake a TigerLake. Zranitelné tedy jsou tedy stovky modelů od Lenovo, Dell, Acer a HP.
articles.title: Zranitelnost UEFIcanhazbufferowerflow ohrožuje počítače s procesorem Intel a biosem Phoenix

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ku příležitosti letních slev na GOG.com je možné zdarma získat RPG hru Shadows: Awakening, která je dílem slovenského studia Games Farm a je součástí fantasy série Heretic Kingdoms.
articles.title: Hra Shadows: Awakening na GOG.com zdarma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Pokud máte v různých herních obchodech nakoupeny digitální hry za spousty peněz, mohlo by vás zajímat, co se s nimi stane po vaší smrti. Mohou se dědit? Na Steamu máte smůlu. Účet na Steamu patří jenom vám a nejde převést na jinou osobu. Neoficiálně je možné blízkým sdělit heslo, ale je otázka do jaké míry je to legální. Navíc je stále častější použití 2FA.
articles.title: Co se stane s digitálními hrami po vaší smrti?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Japonský telekomunikační gigant Softbank, který je mimochodem je stále vlastníkem ARM, plánuje pomocí AI měnit hlas naštvaných zákazníků, aby zněl klidněji. Technologii nazývají „emotion canceling“ zřejmě podle vzoru noise canceling.
articles.title: Softbank plánuje měnit hlas naštvaných zákazníků pomocí AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Mára)
articles.description: Agentura Reuters upozornila, že Bidenova administrativa tento čtvrtek oznámila plány na zákaz prodeje antivirového softwaru produkovaného ruskou firmou Kaspersky Lab ve Spojených státech.
articles.title: Prodej softwaru firmy Kaspersky bude v USA kvůli vazbám na Rusko zakázán

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Atom)
articles.description: Před pár dny se tu objevila zprávička o "Chat Control", tedy o evropském povinném skenování soukromých zpráv.
articles.title: Legislativa o povinném skenování soukromých zpráv byla vyňata z agendy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chceš začít s programováním? Python je oblíbený programovací jazyk mezi vývojáři i zaměstnavateli a zároveň super vstupenka do světa programování. Nauč se přemýšlet jako programátor a efektivně využívat Python na řešení nejrůznějších problémů. Online Python Akademie znamená celkem 12 týdnů, vždy jedna lekce týdně, večer od 18:00 do 21:00. Následující kurz začíná 7. srpna.
articles.title: Online Python Akademie: začněte s programováním v oblíbeném jazyce (online kurz)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Film The Last Screenwriter (Poslední scenárista) režiséra Petera Luisi je patrně prvním filmem, který celý napsala umělá inteligence. Film napsal ChatGPT a pojednává  známém scenáristovi Jackovi, který se setká s AI. Ačkoliv je zpočátku skeptický, později pochopí, že AI rozumí lidským emocím lépe.
articles.title: Zrušena premiéra filmu The Last Screenwriter, který napsal ChatGPT

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Volba CONFIG_FORCE_NR_CPUS v jádře je schovaná za EXPERTS a umožní jádro zkompilovat s přesně známým počtem procesorů. To zjednoduší například vytváření cpumask, který nemusí být dynamický. Celkově pak je jádro s NR_CPUS=4  asi jen o 46 kB menší. Hodí se tedy pro například pro embedded systémy, ale stejně neušetří hodně.
articles.title: Linus Torvalds zruší FORCE_NR_CPUS, způsobuje zmatky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Dosud používá Fedora pro řízení provozních parametrů počítače démona power-profiles-daemon. S vydáním Fedory 41 však dojde ke změně, kdy tento bude nahrazen slibnějším projektem Tuned. V rámci něho totiž byly vyřešeny překladové API vrstvy mezi Tuned a  power-profiles-daemon.
articles.title: Fedora 41 chystá nahrazení Power-Profiles-Daemon za pokročilejší Tuned

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Každý, kdo poslední dobou s příslušnou verzí systemd pustil příkaz systemd-tmpfiles --purge pro vymazání dočasných souborů, se nestačil divit, neb mu s nimi zmizely i všechny soubory a adresáře s konfigurační službou tmpfiles.d, tedy včetně kompletního  /home.
articles.title: Nová verze systemd 256.1 upravuje systemd-tmpfiles, už nečekaně nesmaže celý /home

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Na blogu sdružení CZ.NIC dnes vyšel článek technického ředitele Zdeňka Brůny, který hodnotí měsíc provozu služby Aukce domén.
articles.title: CZ.NIC hodnotí první měsíc služby Aukce domén

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Dnes a zítra se téměř v celé Evropě koná cvičení Cyber Europe. V letošním roce je primárním cílem této akce otestovat připravenost energetického průmyslu, jako sekundární cílová skupina byla zvolena datacentra, která hrají klíčovou roli ve fungování digitální infrastruktury.
articles.title: Probíhá celoevropské cvičení Cyber Europe 2024

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Sdružení CZ.NIC vydalo novou verzi desktopové Datovky. Mezi novinky verze 4.24.0 patří nové rozložení ovládacích prvků v hlavním okně aplikace nebo přidání parametrů pro příkazovou řádku pro práci s uloženými daty.
articles.title: Do nové verze Datovky byly přidány parametry pro příkazovou řádku pro práci s uloženými daty

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Oblíbený „linuxový“ notebook Framework Laptop 13 bude možné v blízké budoucnosti zcela předělat pomocí nové základní desky na platformu RISC-V (foto výše je pouze ilustrační). Deska byla vytvořena ve spolupráci se společností DeepComputing a jde o budoucí „upgrade“ pro ty, kterým není AMD či Intel dostatečně svobodným řešením.
articles.title: Framework Laptop 13 nabídne základní desku s RISC-V

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na světě je první dílčí aktualizace šestkové Plasmy. Verze 6.1 přináší pár dílčích vylepšení a opravy řady věcí nahlášených uživateli zejména po vydání šestky.
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.1 vylepšuje uživatelský zážitek i běh na Waylandu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Proxmox je moderní virtualizační platforma, která v mnoha případech může nahradit VMware. Je open-source, zdarma a je postaven na otevřených technologiích jako KVM, LXC, CEPH a dalších. Pokud potřebujete provozovat virtualizaci, Proxmox je pro vás ideální stack a na našem workshopu Proxmox se dozvíte, jak na něj.
articles.title: Proxmox: moderní virtualizační platforma schopná nahradit VMware (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Společnost Nvidia je v tuto chvíli tou, která má na světě nejvyšší tržní hodnotu. Dle posledních analýz agentury Bloomberg dosáhla 3,349 biliónů USD, což je o pár desítek miliard dolarů více, než Microsoft s 3,325, resp. Apple s 3,275 bilióny USD.
articles.title: Nvidia je nejhodnotnější firmou na světě, přeskočila Apple i Microsoft

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze The Amnestic Incognito Live System vylepšuje používaný kryptografický systém. Tails nyní ukládá random seed na USB flashku, což z hlediska bezpečnosti ocení mnohé komponenty na dobře zajištěné šifrování spoléhající (perzistentní úložiště, Tor či HTTPS). „Semínko“ je uloženo mimo perzistentní úložiště.
articles.title: Tails 6.4 vylepšuje šifrování

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Phoronix otestoval aktuální FreeBSD 14.1, NetBSD 10.0 a DragonFlyBSD 6.4 oproti Ubuntu 24.04 LTS a CentOS 9, a to na AMD Threadripperu 7980X. Navazuje tak na nedávné srovnání mezi FreeBSD 14.0 a 14.1.
articles.title: Tři BSD versus CentOS a Ubuntu: FreeBSD 14.1 v průměru nejrychlejší

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jako součást prací na budoucí Fedoře 41 vznikají další úpravy instalátoru GNOME Software. S nimi se uživatelům usnadní cesta k instalaci uzavřeného ovladače Nvidia, a to na systémech se zapnutým UEFI Secure Boot. Ovladač Nvidie byl dříve z GNOME Software odstraněn právě kvůli nemožnosti jeho běhu na systému zabezpečeném Secure Bootem, což se změnilo.
articles.title: GNOME Software dostane podporu instalace uzavřeného ovladače Nvidia na strojích se Secure Bootem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nebezpečná zranitelnost CVE-2024–3080 byla objevena v sedmi WiFi routerech Asus. Útočník může bez znalosti hesla vzdáleně obejít přihlašování a přihlásit se do routeru. Zranitelné jsou modely XT8, XT8_V2, RT-AX88U, RT-AX58U, RT-AX5&, RT-AC86U a RT-AC68U.
articles.title: Nebezpečné zranitelnosti WiFi routerů Asus

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přes 70 % společností se zatím nepřipravuje na nový zákon o kybernetické bezpečnosti. Česko je evropskou špičkou v elektronickém sdílení informací, slabší je využívání ERP systémů. Americký výrobce čipů onsemi chce rozšířit za víc než 40 mld. Kč závod v Rožnově. Automatizace sítí pomáhá i jejich bezpečnosti. Sestrojili magnetickou paměť založenou na spirálních magnetech. Firmy vyzvaly Fialu, aby přerušil schvalování zákona o kyberbezpečnosti. S rozvojem AI v Česku pomůže aktualizovaná Národní strategie umělé inteligence.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz:  Americký výrobce čipů onsemi chce rozšířit za víc než 40 mld. Kč závod v Rožnově

Vědci převádí do obrazů počítačové viry a učí umělou inteligenci je rozpoznat. V Česku vznikne národní centrum pro polovodiče a čipy. Umělá inteligence pomůže spolehlivěji odhalit zubní kazy.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Trend DevOps se zadrhl a už nezvyšuje produktivitu. 66 % společností v ČR plně využívá AI nebo to brzy plánuje. Podniky migrují aplikace z virtuálních počítačů na kontejnery Kubernetes. WD představuje novou strukturu způsobu ukládání dat v průběhu pracovního datového cyklu AI. Od 5G k 5.5G. Proč půltá generace?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Trend DevOps se zadrhl a už nezvyšuje produktivitu

articles.description: Přeměnu mezi skyrmiony a antiskyrmiony demonstrovali i při pokojové teplotě. Superhmotné černé díry vznikají jinak, než si astronomové mysleli. 3D tisk z ledu vytváří umělé cévy.

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Related to the work by Mike Blumenkrantz for significantly improving the Mesa glReadPixels performance by more than 100%, the open-source driver developer at Valve has now enabled compute PBO blits within mainline Mesa for the AMD Radeon "RadeonSI" Gallium3D driver...
articles.title: RadeonSI Enables Compute PBO Blits: "Massively Improves Perf In A Number Of Cases"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Llamafile has been one of the better new initiatives out of Mozilla in recent years. Llamafile makes it easy to conveniently distribute and run large language models as a single file while supporting both CPU and GPU execution and all-around making AI LLMs much more approachable for end-users. Out today is Llamafile 0.8.7 with more performance optimizations and new features...
articles.title: Llamafile 0.8.7 Brings Fixes, Better ARM Performance & Preps For New Server

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A new set of patches are currently being tested for improving task scheduling and in turn performance for modern Intel Core hybrid processors. With the patch also mentioning systems that are hybrid but without SMT, this looks like it may be some early tuning as well for upcoming Intel Lunar Lake processors that lack Hyper Threading...
articles.title: Intel P-State Patches Further Tune Linux For Better Scheduling On Hybrid CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With Ubuntu 24.10 due for release in October one of the expressed planned changes has been NVIDIA defaulting to using Wayland rather than X11 for the default desktop session. As of this past week the change is now in place for Ubuntu 24.10 daily users that will find Wayland-by-default when using the official NVIDIA Linux graphics driver...
articles.title: Ubuntu 24.10 Now Defaults To Wayland On NVIDIA

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Just a friendly reminder that if you've been procrastinating in migrating past the once-great CentOS Linux 7, there is less than one week to go now until it's officially end-of-life...
articles.title: CentOS Linux 7 Is End-Of-Life Next Week

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Qualcomm engineers on Sunday posted patches for enabling the Adreno X1-85 GPU within the MSM DRM driver. The Adreno X1-85 GPU is what's found within the Snapdragon X Elite SoC powering various new Windows ARM laptops although the Linux support continues maturing too for these platforms...
articles.title: Qualcomm Aiming For Snapdragon X Elite GPU Support In Linux 6.11

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back during the Linux 6.9 kernel cycle support was added for the ASUS ROG Raikiri as a newer gaming controller. Now on its way for landing in Linux 6.10 is support for the ASUS ROG Raikiri Pro...
articles.title: ASUS ROG Raikiri Pro Controller Support Being Added To Linux 6.10

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Linus Torvalds has just tagged Linux 6.10-rc5 as the newest weekly test release leading up to the Linux 6.10 stable release by mid-July...
articles.title: Linux 6.10-rc5 Released With This Kernel Cycle Looking Good So Far

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in 2019 after various speculation-based CPU vulnerabilities began coming to light, Amazon engineers proposed process-local memory allocations for hiding KVM secrets. They were striving for an alternative mitigation for vulnerabilities like L1TF by essentially providing some memory regions for kernel allocations out of view/access from other kernel code. Amazon engineers this week laid out a new proposal after five years of ongoing Linux kernel improvements for MM-local memory allocations for dealing with current and future speculation-based cross-process attacks...
articles.title: Amazon Exploring MM-Local Memory Allocations To Help With Current/Future Speculation Attacks

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Linux kernel community has sadly lost one of its longtime, prolific contributors to the wireless (WiFi) drivers...
articles.title: Longtime Linux Wireless Developer Passes Away

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The uutils project has released Rust Coreutils 0.0.27 as the newest feature update to this Rust-written, drop-in replacement to the GNU Coreutils as the common set of utilities found on Linux systems and other platforms...
articles.title: Rust Coreutils 0.0.27 Continues The Climb Of Better GNU Coreutils Interoperability

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: On Friday more AMDGPU/AMDKFD kernel driver changes were submitted for the upcoming Linux 6.11 cycle by way of DRM-Next. We're nearing the end of feature work to DRM-Next before the Linux 6.11 merge window begins in mid-July while this latest AMD pull request continues preparing for upcoming RDNA4 graphics hardware among other changes...
articles.title: AMD Readies More Kernel Graphics Driver Code For Linux 6.11, Enables DCC For RDNA4

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Red Hat engineer Leonardo Bras has laid out a proposal for QPWs, or "Queue PerCPU Work", as a better means of handling per-CPU operations within the Linux kernel especially for real-time (RT) workloads...
articles.title: Red Hat Proposes Queue PerCPU Work "QPW" For Better Handling Per-CPU Work On RT Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Flathub as the centralized repository for serving Flatpak sandboxed Linux applications crossed the threshold this weekend of serving more than two billion downloads...
articles.title: Flathub Has Now Served More Than Two Billion Downloads For Flatpaks

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Another round of Bcachefs file-system fixes were merged today for the in-development Linux 6.10 kernel...
articles.title: Bcachefs Making Tiny Steps Toward Full Self-Healing Capabilities

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Merged on Friday to LLVM 19 Git is a generic MLIR to SPIR-V pass for lowering the Multi-Level Intermediate Representation down into SPIR-V as the intermediate representation consumed by OpenGL / OpenCL / Vulkan drivers...
articles.title: AMD AI Compiler Engineer Lands A Generic MLIR To SPIR-V Pass In LLVM 19

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: GNOME developers continue to be very busy with a variety of initiatives thanks to the Sovereign Tech Fund (STF) financing as well as other general development efforts as they work their way toward GNOME 47 in September...
articles.title: GNOME Seeing Much Work On Their "Setup" OEM Style Installer, Key Rack & oo7

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following this week's great KDE Plasma 6.1 desktop release, developers have been fixing some minor bugs and other issues that were raised by early users of this updated open-source Qt6-powered desktop...
articles.title: KDE's Cube Effect Now Launches More Reliably & Other Post-6.1 Plasma Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mike Blumenkrantz of Valve's open-source/Linux graphics driver team has submitted a merge request to "massively" improve the OpenGL glReadPixels performance within the common Mesa state tracker...
articles.title: Blumenkrantz "Massively Improves" Mesa's glReadPixels Performance With 7 Lines Of Code

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While more software piles on AI features these days, today's release of the Darktable 4.8 RAW photography software has removed one of its AI features after realizing it only delivers mediocre quality...
articles.title: Darktable 4.8 Pulls AI Feature After Discovering It Doesn't Work Well

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: VKD3D-Proton 2.13 is now available as the newest version of this Direct3D 12 over Vulkan API translation later that is used by Valve's Steam Play (Proton) for accelerating D3D12 Windows games on Linux...
articles.title: VKD3D-Proton 2.13 Brings OpenVR/OpenXR Interop & Performance Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With some Linux users not liking the recently showcased new Linux "Blue Screen of Death" for kernel panics, Red Hat engineer Javier Martinez Canillas who has been one of those involved in the new DRM Panic infrastructure showed that it can also be a "black screen of death" if so desired...
articles.title: Linux Can Have A "Black Screen Of Death" For Kernel Panics

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Earlier this week was a proposal for creating a new Mesa legacy driver branch for clearing out older OpenGL drivers like the ATI R300, AMD R600, Lima, Nouveau NV30, and other older GPU drivers. However, other upstream Mesa developers aren't convinced by the proposal...
articles.title: Mesa Developers Aren't Convinced Over Dropping Old OpenGL Drivers Right Now

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Cloud Hypervisor 40.0 is out today for this open-source Rust-written VMM that started off as an Intel software project and evolved into a multi-vendor initiative with backing from the likes of Microsoft, Arm, AMD, and others for a cloud-focused, security-critical virtualization hypervisor...
articles.title: Cloud Hypervisor 40 Released With Better Boot Time Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel software engineers have been upstreaming the Lunar Lake support for Linux a number of months already and the basics appear in good shape, aside from the Xe2 graphics enablement being an ongoing matter. Much of the rest of the core functionality has appeared to be in good shape ahead of Lunar Lake laptops launching in Q3, but it seems there have been a few missing power management related bits...
articles.title: Intel Lunar Lake Workload Hints & Power Floor Patches Posted For Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Newly merged patches for Mesa 24.2 slightly enhance the default out-of-the-box build experience for the open-source OpenGL and Vulkan drivers on POWER/PowerPC platforms...
articles.title: Building Mesa On POWER Now Presents A Default Set Of OpenGL & Vulkan Drivers

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Intel Xe driver is working on supporting PMT functionality with a new set of patches that may be mainlined for Linux v6.11~6.12...
articles.title: Intel Xe Driver Seeing PMT Support For Alchemist & Battlemage

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While not talked about as much as the likes of the Intel Gaudi accelerators with their upstream Habana Labs kernel driver or the AMD Instinct MI300 series with their open-source upstream support too, back in 2022 Qualcomm did post an open-source kernel driver for their Cloud AI accelerator. That was followed by an open-source compiler and user-space stack and in turn the QAIC driver was upstreamed into the accelerator (accel) subsystem last year with Linux 6.4...
articles.title: Qualcomm Cloud AI 100 "AIC100" Firmware Upstreamed

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel on Wednesday released version 1.5 of their Linux NPU driver, their user-space driver component for Linux systems in enabling the neural processing unit found with Core Ultra "Meteor Lake" processors and newer. This goes along with their upstream IVPU kernel accelerator driver for allowing a full open-source solution for AI workloads with the likes of OpenVINO...
articles.title: Intel Linux NPU Driver v1.5 Released - Now Validated On Arrow Lake & Lunar Lake

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While the Raspberry Pi 5 debuted last September, the mainline Linux kernel support for this popular single board  computer continues to lag behind the state of Raspberry Pi's downstream kernel. SUSE has been working to upstream various Raspberry Pi 5 driver support while now Raspberry Pi engineers have also begun the trek toward upstreaming their kernel graphics driver support...
articles.title: Raspberry Pi 5 Kernel Graphics Driver Support Will Hopefully Be Upstreamed Soon

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: After last week looking at how FreeBSD 14.1 has improved performance over FreeBSD 14.0, here is an expanded cross-OS comparison now looking at how the new FreeBSD 14.1 stable release compares to the recently released NetBSD 10.0, the current DragonFlyBSD 6.4 release, and then CentOS Stream 9 and Ubuntu 24.04 LTS for some Linux comparison data points.
articles.title: FreeBSD 14.1 vs. DragonFlyBSD 6.4 vs. NetBSD 10 vs. Linux Benchmarks

articles.description: Debuting last week was FreeBSD 14.1 with performance improvements and more. Given there being some performance optimizations and other upgrades like a more recent LLVM Clang compiler by default, I've begun running some benchmarks of this newest FreeBSD stable release. In today's article is a quick comparison of FreeBSD 14.1 vs. FreeBSD 14.0 performance using an AMD Ryzen Threadripper 7980X 64-core processor within the System76 Thelio Major workstation.
articles.title: FreeBSD 14.1 vs. FreeBSD 14.0 Benchmarks On AMD Ryzen Threadripper

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
As with all live service games, Final Fantasy XIV must undergo periods of maintenance before expansions and patches. We're accustomed to the typical 6-12 hour server outages as FFXIV undergoes the usual updates, but expansions like Dawntrail are a whole other ballgame. 


It's a good time to plan ahead, as login queues after FFXIV completes its Dawntrail maintenance will surely entail a lengthy wait—though hopefully, it'll be smoother than Endwalker. Anyway, here's the rundown on FFXIV Dawntrail early access, maintenance, and when you can download the update via the Square Enix launcher. 


FFXIV maintenance: Dawntrail, early access, and download times


June 26 to 28 - Dawntrail Maintenance for Version 7.0


FFXIV Dawntrail maintenance begins at approximately 2 a.m. PDT on June 26 and wil…
articles.title: FFXIV Dawntrail maintenance schedule: Launcher download, early access, and patch times

articles.author: Annie Thelen
articles.description:
Like many other RPGs, Baldur’s Gate 3 has plenty of side quests you can pick up along your journey for extra loot and rewards. Many of these side quests are rescue missions, to save NPCs you’ve come across from a horrible fate. One of these is Omeluum. 


Omeluum, a friendly Mind Flayer from the Underdark who is a part of the Society of Brilliance, is one of the NPCs who will be in need of rescue later in the story. If you’re looking to learn how to save it and complete the Retrieve Omeluum quest, we’ve got you covered.


Where to find Omeluum in BG3


Even though you meet Omeluum in Act 1, the Retrieve Omeluum side quest will take place during Act 3 of the main story, in which it will be found as a prisoner inside The Iron Throne. This quest can be picked up during Save the Gondians, wher…
articles.title: Baldur’s Gate 3 (BG3): Retrieve Omeluum quest guide

Much like its predecessors, Elden Ring often drops mysterious keys with no clear direction on where to bring  them. The Well Depths Key in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree is one such item, but luckily we can figure out where to take it rather quickly. 


You'll find the Well Depths Key in Belurat, the Tower Settlement to the northwest of where you begin your journey in the Elden Ring DLC. It's located in a room that's cut off from a main path but is accessible with just the right amount of exploration and light hopping. The key opens a door at the bottom of a well, but we can tackle that step later.


Where to find the Well Depths Key in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree


The fastest way to the Well Depths Key location is to start at the 'Small Private Altar' Site of Grace, the second s…
articles.title: How to find and where to use the Well Depths Key in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree

articles.author: David Morgan
articles.description:
The Sword of Light in Shadow of the Erdtree is a disco ball in straight-sword form. If you want to buff your Holy damage with the added bonus of shooting more lasers than a novelty lamp from Spencer's, you'll just need to complete two simple steps.


First, get the Stone-Sheathed Sword


First thing's first, we'll need an unassuming looking stone sword found in the Ruins of Rauh. It's only obtainable after you unclog the area's Spirit Spring, shortly after the section of Scarlet Rot and red Pest enemies. Once you've got the Spirit Spring flowing, make your way to the following location on the map to find an invisible bridge. Cross it, and take the sword from the altar.


Screenshot by Destructoid.


Screenshot by Destructoid.








Next, head to Unte Ruins


If you haven't found or unlocked the Unte Ruins, don't fret. We have a handy guide for both finding and unlocking them. Basically, you'll just be taking a somewhat hidden ladder in Shadow Keep, then heading through an illusory wall to get to the ruins. Then it's just a quick toss of a Hefty Furnace Pot into the slumbering Golem's head to make your way inside.


Screenshot by Destructoid.


Screenshot by Destructoid.








Once you've gained access to the ruins, you'll be able to place the Stone-Sheathed Sword in the alter (much like the one you pulled it from) to transform it into the Sword of Light. 


Screenshot by Destructoid.


The Weapon Art, simply called Light, boosts Holy Damage for about a minute on activation. This buff also applies after the sword has been sheathed, so keeping it handy in an offhand slot could be useful for maximizing the damage of your Incantations.

The post How to get the Sword of Light in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to get the Sword of Light in Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree

Streamer Guy "Dr. Disrespect" Beahm has been officially dropped from The Midnight Society, a game studio he helped co-found. The departure follows an investigation conducted by the studio into new allegations surrounding Beahm's ban from Twitch in 2020.

Beahm was banned in 2020, in a move that was understood at the time to be permanent, though the reasons around it were never given in overtly explicit terms. After the post emerged and started to get shared around, Beahm posted…

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
Fortnite, the popular battle royale game, is seemingly set to introduce another Marvel superhero skin soon. A reliable Fortnite leaker, @ShiinaBR on Twitter, has revealed that Epic Games is looking to bring the ‘Weapon X’ skin to Fortnite. 


The skin will have five items as part of the cosmetic bundle and is based on a character from Marvel's X-Men series. Shiina claims that the skin will arrive in Fortnite on July 5, but its shop section is “still unfinished” at the moment.




For those unfamiliar, Weapon X was the codename for the Wolverine after he underwent a series of twisted experiments to create the perfect weapon. The leaked Fortnite skin carries the look inspired by the comics and the X-Men '97 animated series, with Wolverine wearing a metal helmet that is used to control him. Those who have seen the X-Men Apocalypse movie would also be able to recognise the skin, as the movie featured a cameo from Hugh Jackman donning the Weapon X look.


Since we’re on the subject, it is more than plausible that the Wolverine skin is coming in to continue the hype, not just for the revived X-Men '97 animated series but also for the Deadpool and Wolverine movie, which is slated for a release next month on July 26.


Fortnite has long been the home for crossovers in gaming, with collaborations across pop culture with artists, movie characters, and more. There have been a handful of Marvel characters who have made their way to the game, some even as playable characters. Iron Man, Doctor Strange, Thanos, Loki, Captain America, Spider-Man, and Thor are just some of the many who have been added to Fortnite at some point. Most recently, Hulk and Hela were added in Chapter 5 Season 2 in April 2024, and interestingly, it was their look from Thor: Ragnarok, the MCU movie that came out in 2017.

The post Fortnite leak suggests Weapon X skin from X-Men is coming appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Fortnite leak suggests Weapon X skin from X-Men is coming

articles.author: Moulik Mathur
articles.description:
Bioware’s upcoming Dragon Age: The Veilguard title will have a Quality and Performance mode on the PS5 and Xbox Series X/S consoles at launch, an EA representative told IGN. Typically the Quality mode setting on the consoles targets 30 FPS and prioritizes fidelity. As for the Performance mode, the game will look to target 60 FPS.


While the existence of Quality and Performance modes is welcoming news, the EA representative did not reveal the resolution that these modes would be running the game at. However, the typical expectation from the Quality mode would be 4K native resolution whereas the performance mode will look to hit 60 FPS at 1440p resolution. Dragon Age: The Veilguard is built on the Frostbite Engine.


The EA rep told IGN, “Dragon Age: The Veilguard will feature performance and quality modes on consoles to ensure players can choose the visual fidelity they prefer. We’ll have more to share on exact performance as we finish development in the coming months.”


Dragon Age: The Veilguard, the title originally announced as Dragon Age: Dreadwolf, was recently showcased at the Xbox Games Showcase. The title will take place 10 years after the events of Dragon Age: Inquisition, 2014’s Game of the Year. Players will get to travel to new locations in Thedas, and Dragon Age: The Veilguard will feature Solas as the antagonist. 


Dragon Age: The Veilguard will be released on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. The game is slated for a release in Fall 2024.

The post Will Dragon Age: The Veilguard have a Performance Mode on PS5 & Xbox Series X/S? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Will Dragon Age: The Veilguard have a Performance Mode on PS5 & Xbox Series X/S?

articles.description:
Months after its original release, Update 2 has officially hit Five Nights TD (FNTD). The hefty update adds a ton of new content including new systems, towers, units, and the frequently requested AFK Zone. Let's go over everything added in Five Nights TD Update 2 and detail all thew new content.


Screenshot by Destructoid


What's new in Five Nights TD Update 2?


Even though the creators of Five Nights TD haven't released actual patch notes for Update 2, we can still look at everything new added in the recently released update. The update has been a long time in the making, having f finally released on June 22, 2024. With the update coming so long after the original release of FNTD, a ton of bug fixes and balance changes are present in the update. Aside from those fixes and changes, here is all the actual new content added with Update 2:



New Clans System - Players can now team up together by joining Clans and work together to progress the Clan via acquiring Clan Points.

A present system for clans - Clans can receive rewards in the form of presents based on the Clan Points they accrue.




The AFK Zone - New option for going into the AFK Zone when stepping away from the game to gather rewards at a slower rate.


3 New Units - Three brand new units that can be acquired via summoning.

New Rarity for Unit Summons - All new Secret rarity for units that joins Common, Rare, Epic, and Mythic.


Splash Damage increased - All units with Splash Damage have seen the damage amount increased with this patch to make it more viable.





Also, even though it didn't make it in the actual update, the creators teased some new maps that take place outside that will be temporarily added next week as part of a time-limited Summer Event.

The post Five Nights TD (FNTD) Update 2 details appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Five Nights TD (FNTD) Update 2 details

articles.author: Paula Vaynshteyn
articles.description:
It’s not often that a real-life place I’m familiar with gets turned into a staple from Final Fantasy XIV, but today is apparently an exception to this, with London King’s Cross train station getting its very own Aetheryte. 


The sculpture has appeared ahead of the FFXIV London Fan Meet on June 24, where players can come together and share stories, memories, and potentially even meet some of their Eorzean friends in real life. 




When announced on June 17, the available 150 tickets to the London Fan Meet sold out in under an hour. Those who were lucky enough to get tickets, as well as those who weren’t, have been heading into London King’s Cross to attune to this real-life Aetheryte. 


It must be nice for those traveling down to London to be met with something familiar from Final Fantasy XIV. Honestly, I’m a little bit tempted to head down to London myself, as this sculpture will only be in its spot today. While the sculpture is definitely not life-sized, it’s still nice to see something from a game that I love so openly placed in the real world.


However, the London Fan Meet has begun ripples of a discussion among players about the lack of notice provided. The meet was announced at 11 a.m. on a Monday morning, when the majority of FFXIV players would be at work. Even if they did manage to see the Tweet, it’s unlikely that they could get time off work with only a few days' notice. 


The Aetheryte in the area outside King’s Cross is another example of this. There are a huge number of British players who I’m sure would have loved the chance to see it, but it will be gone after today. 


Regardless, this is still a pretty cool thing to know is happening, even if I can’t attend myself. And I’m sure there are a lot of confused Londoners wondering why people are trying to touch the strange blue rock, which is certainly an amusing thought.

The post London King’s Cross gets its own FFXIV Aetheryte ahead of fan meet-up and Dawntrail appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: London King’s Cross gets its own FFXIV Aetheryte ahead of fan meet-up and Dawntrail

Apex Legends is set to host a new event dubbed Double Take, which will be introducing Quads to the battle royale game on June 25, 2024. Players will be now able to form 4-person squads in the Apex Games until the end of Season 21.


Developer Respawn Entertainment has said that the loot pool has been updated too, with more ammo, attachments, and health items spread over the map to bring down the chaos of fighting for resources. While Tridents will only carry three people, Valkyrie’s Ultimate ability will be able to carry four teammates at the same time.




Ranked Rumble


Apex Legends will also be introducing Ranked Rumble, a new game mode, at the end of the Ranked season. Kicking off on August 3, the Ranked Rumble will introduce leaderboards based on Rank Tier, for players to compete in and climb.


There will be 10 Ranked Rumble Matches that players can engage in, and finishing at the top of the leaderboard can earn you unique badges. All players who have earned a Rank this season are automatically eligible for Ranked Rumble, which will end on August 6, and the Ranked season ends with it.


While the season ends with Ranked Rumble, the placement on the leaderboard will not impact a player’s Ranked Points, Ranked Season placement or rewards which will be locked in once Ranked Rumble commences.


Collection event items


As is tradition, a new event brings with it new limited-time cosmetics for players to earn or purchase, as 24 new items will be available during the event. There will be Legendary skins for Octane, Crypto, Fuse, Conduit, Revenant, and Alter. Lifeline gets special treatment for this event, with a Prestige Skin and a new finisher for players to unlock after collecting all 24 items.

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
BitLife weekly challenges often ask you to be born in a specific country or region. While some have countries like Japan, Ireland, or Romania, most take place in the United States, with Arizona being one of many options during challenges like Love is Love. 


How to live in Arizona in BitLife


Being born in Arizona requires choosing the United States as your starting country and either Tucson or Phoenix as your starting place. Your best bet is to choose Phoenix, as this typically works for any challenge asking you to be born in Arizona. However, if it doesn't for some reason, you have Tucson as a backup plan.


You can use similar strategies to be born in other US states in BitLife, too. For example, if a challenge asks to be born in Alaska, you'll have to choose Anchorage as your starting place. Likewise, if you encounter Tennessee, California, or New Jersey, you'll pick places like Nashville, Los Angeles, or Newark. BitLife uses real-world locations for these challenges, so a quick search on what cities are in a specific US state can help you knock out these objectives easily.


When you begin a new BitLife challenge, check your character's starting gender or stats. Sometimes, you'll have to begin as a male or female or have a certain percentage value in looks or smarts. Many challenges avoid these requirements altogether, but it's good to watch for this, just in case. 


Another important part to check is a challenge's other tasks. For example, having a criminal special talent will make things easier if it's crime-centered. Similarly, if you have to become a famous musician, selecting a musical special talent helps you raise singing or instrument mastery faster. You're usually not required to pick a talent for your character, but they'll help you complete BitLife challenges quickly.

The post How to be born in Arizona in BitLife appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to be born in Arizona in BitLife

articles.author: Shawn Robinson
